website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for gamers and power users, a powerful, highly rated laptop cooling pad with five fans for laptops up to 17 inches.
pros: Powerful fans provide 65 CFM of airflow, keeping even the hottest laptops cool
Includes adjustable height, non-slip baffle and a roller switch to turn fan on and off, as well as adjust the speed
Fans are very quiet, even on the highest setting
cons: Only comes with two USB ports rather than four

customer_reviews.title: Cools my gaming laptop well
customer_reviews.text: This arrived yesterday with my new gaming system and it's just what I was looking for. Temp readings were recorded during a full raid with my graphics on high/ultra. I did not have my systems coolboost on so the heat dispersion here is all thanks to the cooling pad. Sturdy material, stout little legs and a small lip that keeps the laptop from sliding, although, if you're on a flat surface it's not going to slide anyway. It fits my 15.6 laptop perfectly and could hold a slightly bigger machine with ease. If you're looking for a pad to cool your gaming system then this is the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oh my gosh this thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have my 17 inch gaming laptop on this thing all the time. My laptop is usually on the couch or on the bed so this helps provide air flow on those soft surfaces, even without the fans on this things helps. I only plug in the fans when I am gaming and boy does it help bring those temperatures down. Not loud at all and the red lights I barely notice since my laptop pretty much covers the entire thing. Highly recommend to anybody that has a laptop, especially a gaming laptop.
customer_reviews.author: The Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop Cooling Pad For Gaming Laptops!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best cooling pad I have ever used for my Laptops. I currently have a Inspiron 5000 Gaming Computer and the Cooling Pad works amazing! Everything from the packaging to the actual Cooling Pad is well designed! I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a cooling pad. You will not find a better price on a laptop cooling pad that works this well! Buy one today you will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: This thing works awesome. I work from home and when I use ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works awesome. I work from home and when I use this the bottom of my laptop gets so hot. I put this under it and it kept it cooled down all day. I really feel like the cool temper enhances the performance of my laptop. I didn't have any issues with it bogging down or anything. No batteries or charging is the best feature about this. It also didn't drain my laptop battery down any faster. I actually felt like the battery lasted longer. and tge cool LED lights on fan makes it more better.
customer_reviews.author: Siddhartha Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: WHAT'S NOT TO LIKE!
customer_reviews.text: Five fans with speed control! WHAT'S NOT TO LIKE! Keeps my laptop cool. I have a 17" laptop and the sides slightly protrude over the cooling pad, but that doesn't effect the cooling at all. I like the design of the cooling pad and the little pop-up lip in the front that keeps your laptop in place works great. As I mentioned it has a fan speed control and the USB port connector that it comes with is nice. These little details make this an excellent buy for the price. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.  Extremely quiet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Extremely quiet. Cooled down my "Easy Bake Oven," oops, I mean my old laptop that has a broken fan, by 59°F, from 220F (auto shutdown temp) to 169°F. Job well done Havit, job well done
customer_reviews.author: C W

customer_reviews.title: I love this product.
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised, excellent quality, met my expectations. It is light weight, and very quiet (unlike other laptop coolers I have owned). The packaging was a really pleasant surprise, it mirrors the quality of the product and the obvious pride of the manufacturer in their work. I would recommend this item to anyone who spends hundreds on a laptop and wants it to last. Would buy in again.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Item came soaked in some weird chemical!
customer_reviews.text: Item arrive with outer package dry but with an overbearing chemical scent. When opened the smell was choking me. The inner package was as pictured above, damp and that horrific smell that I cannot get out of my nose! I didn't even pull it out all the way, shoved it back in the box and is packaged to be returned. UPS better not give me an issue taking this smelly thing! This had to be put in the UPS box this way as the outer UPS box was completely dry and I used it to send the product back, it does however STINK! Doesn't deserve even a 1 star but you cannot post without it.
customer_reviews.author: WickedLilFairy

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately not what you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: On the highest setting there is virtually no noise but only because the fan speeds are so slow you can barely feel any air coming out of it. I first thought they weren't even on but you can clearly tell they are spinning while looking at it but you won't feel any breeze. Perhaps the fans were installed upside down? I could feel a semblance of airflow from 2 out of the 5 fans but literally nothing from others. At least my laptop is off the desk and on something vented now but I wouldn't buy this for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Norris

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it's a perfect fit for my 15.6" Dell Inspiron 15 7567. However, I would not buy this for a 17" laptop. You can plug it into a USB port on your laptop, or plug it into your wall similar to a phone charger. I prefer to do this to reduce battery use in my laptop, and leave the USB port available for my external hard drive. Fans are quiet and red lighting does not bleed. This is not my first HAVIT product, and will not be my last.
customer_reviews.author: Aidin McLaurin

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for laptops in my household. They work really well to control the computer temperature. I read reviews of my computer saying there was a big problem with the keyboard getting unbearably hot after gaming for a few hours. With this fan, my keyboard does not overheat at all. If running gaming applications, the fans can get a little loud, but in this scenario we are wearing headphones and do not notice the sound much. Overall, it I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GregL

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for my PS4 PRO (for the loud fan issue everyone seems to be having) and I’ll be honest I’m pretty disappointed in its performance especially considering it had so many great reviews. Maybe I got a defect? But it doesn’t seem like it. The air that pushes out of this thing is not only weak, but even when using it on my laptop it’s just not that great. I have an older laptop cooler that’s quieter and blows air harder and I’ve had that for close to 6 years now. I’m sure there’s better products out there.
customer_reviews.author: Vrain

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.text: Literally just received from USPS 5 minutes ago. Hooked it up, nothing. No power. Switch moves but no fans, no power not even LED's. How can you sell this. After it didnt work with my laptop, I used a different cable. Then tried a desktop, then a direct AC power bank. Nada. Very cheap, skeptical, all these chinese manufacturers make the same things, remove a fan, name it something different and there is absolutely NO quality control. Please, do not make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Description!
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost - the description is very misleading. The 2 USB ports are NOT extra ports, as the description would lead a buyer to believe. One of the ports is for power - which plugs into your laptop - directly taking up one of your laptop's ports. The second port is a replacement port for the one above. The fans ARE quiet; however, they do not really produce enough cool air to really cool down your laptop - they lower the temp by maybe 2 degrees - so they do function - minimally.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D.

customer_reviews.title: No more overheating!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in March of 2018 and we love it. Light weight, easy to use ... and keeps our old laptop at a normal temperature (it used to get HOT!). The cable (that goes from the pad to the laptop) was much too long for our comfort (cat tails are very strong!) so we bought one from that bidding place online (couldn't find one on Amazon) for $2.50 called USB 3.0 A Male 90 Degree Right Angle to A Male Left Angled Plug Short Cable, which has made this pad perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: InPinkClover

customer_reviews.title: 4/5 fans worked but customer service saved the day
customer_reviews.text: Update: Seller contacted me and immediately offered to send out a replacement and allowed me to keep the broken one. Customer service was amazing and glad that I chose this fan over all the competition, My gaming laptop never gets hot anymore. Did research on the the best lap desks with fans to protect my new gaming laptop, was so excited for this to come in the mail to try it out. Got it today and immediately set it all up, I turn it on and only 4 of the 5 work. The 5th will flicker for .0002 seconds immediately after switching on. Looks cool but apparently the manufacturer didn’t do well.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hester

customer_reviews.title: Generous warranty!
customer_reviews.text: My first one worked just fine until about 6 months after I bought it, when one of the fans started making a horrible grinding noise. I was able to keep it under control for 4 more months before 3 of the 5 fans started making that noise. After leaving a negative review here, I was reminded of the 18 month warranty and emailed Havit's support line. Within 4 days, I received a new cooling pad of slightly higher quality than what I purchased 10 months ago! Overall, I'm very impressed with the customer service, but less so with the actual product so far...
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Dean

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my laptop.
customer_reviews.text: May be better for ultrabooks, but it barely cooled my gaming laptop. Only made a difference of maybe 2c-3c max. It was quiet, but because it put out very little air. I got a 2 fan version from another brand that outputs more air.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Fans Fail After Six Months
customer_reviews.text: Is there a vender out there that sells laptop coolers where the fans do not constantly fail after six months use? My desktop computers run day and night and the fans don't begin to fail for several years of use. Why do they put these cheap-ass fans into these laptop coolers?
customer_reviews.author: prizm1

customer_reviews.title: Well design but!
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of the pad with the two USB ports and the adjustable fan speed. However, they put the two USB on one side and my USB ports on the other side made it inconvenient to connect the pad to my computer. I wish they either put the USB ports in the back, one in each side or send a longer USB cable. The description says " Whisper Quiet fans". The only time the fans are whisper quiet when I turn them off. I just received my cooling pad yesterday so I will keep updating my review with time.
customer_reviews.author: SEMSEM

customer_reviews.title: so far its been great at cooling my mac book pro 2014
customer_reviews.text: so far it keeps my mac book pro 2014 cool...ive tried atleast 5 others and this is the only one that has kept my laptop cool...the top left of my laptop used to always get hot and this cooling pad makes it cool to the touch... i like putting my mac on my lap...and couldnt with any other without feeling the heat....i dont feel it the heat when using this one almost all reviews only talk bout puttin it on a desk ...and i bet most people put their macs on their laps.. so far its been great..now it only has to last...
customer_reviews.author: chaik george

customer_reviews.title: Cooling as Expected
customer_reviews.text: My son's laptop was overheating. He has a multi-screen setup with two graphics cards. No doubt this was contributing to the computer's over heating. This cooling pad completely resolved the issue. He's now been using it for just over 3 months. It's still working great. In fact, it worked so well, that we bought one for our other son's laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I've had it for a year.
customer_reviews.text: It has been stationary for a year so it hasn't been banned around except for extremely slight moving around on desk. The rubber grippy on the bottom fell off so it slides a bit more... two of them are still there. This isn't such a big deal. The problem is... the half fans still work..sort of? There is some electrical issue within the switch. About two fans work at at time but most of the time it remains broken. Pretty much garbage and wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older laptop cooling fan that was an incredibly stupid design with a cord too short to reach the other side of my older laptop's usb slot. I bought the HAVIT 5-fans cooler fan. I will buy another of these in the future if I need another. It is an excellent design, the quietest laptop fan I've ever had, stable, and the legs that lift up the HAVIT are solid - not pieces of junk that easily break like other fans I've had in the past. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: R.  Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good lap desk fan
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quiet lap desk for laptops. The only problem is that I have one smaller lap desk with fewer fans that move more air than this one. If I wasn't always running warmer than the normal person and my old laptop didn't need more air cooling it, I would have kept this one. It is a nice model. Light, quiet, and easy to handle. I also like the plugs on the right side of the product and not on the back side. I am returning this and purchasing one that may be a better fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Shopper 2016

customer_reviews.title: Not Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews on this cooling pad I had High Hopes :( The fans do not move a lot of air at all. I was really hoping for faster fans that would cool my laptop down better. But this is not the product. Yes it has 2 USB ports but 1 has to be used to power the cooling pad. I will keep it but had to order another fan to connect to the cooling port on my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Griff

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Even with the pad raised to encourage air flow, the fans are not strong enough to aid in cooling a laptop. The video showcasing the weak air flow with a tissue is accurate. With an MSi laptop, after cleaning out the fans and replacing the thermal paste and buying an additional fan, I was still dealing with the sound card cutting out from overheating. When I turned on a temperature display on my other fan I did not notice a temperature drop when using this cooling pad. I returned this for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: EnchantedElle

customer_reviews.title: Consistently Cool
customer_reviews.text: Works great and has never failed me over the last two months. I am using it, believe it or not, as a source of cool air under an HP Elite desktop PC, inside of a four-shelf network center in my home, and it just keeps on running. In this configuration, I am currently able to avoid having a datacenter-type raised floor area or any other complicated, space-consuming, expensive cooling solution. Does exactly what it's built to do, even in this unusual setup. Well done, HAVIT peeps!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Yurth

customer_reviews.title: Well it IS quiet.....
customer_reviews.text: It's VERY quiet. Probably because it really doesn't seem to move much air. With the pad plugged into my USB port or on a separate power source (i.e. a phone charger) and turned up to highest setting, there's barely any air felt with my hand directly above any of the fans. I mean there IS some air, just not enough IMO to really make a difference to help cool my gaming computer. I guess something is better than nothing, but I'll be looking for another cooling pad to compare.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Fans barely blow compared to mine and a friends
customer_reviews.text: Product is okay. I bought it for my acer predator and I didn't like the air flow. It seems really low and you almost can't feel it even blowing. I gave it to my gf and order the cm storm which is way better but cost more. Lights and fans are one so you can't shut off lights without shutting off fans also.
customer_reviews.author: Johnni

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cooling pad for my gaming laptop
customer_reviews.text: I researched the best reviewed cooling pads for laptops on Amazon and this one got the best reviews, so I tried it and I agree that this gets the job done. When it's on full blast, you can hardly hear the fans and the LED lights won't bother you because your laptop will be covering it. I had frame rate problems on my gaming laptop due to overheating but this cooling pad helped fix my problem and no choppiness and frame drops while gaming. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sotomayor

customer_reviews.title: Great for long use on Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I am not a heavy gamer so to speak but I play games all night long on the computer, hidden object, bingo easy on the computer..this fan has kept it cool since day one. A bit pricey but again I use it every night. I am not impressed with the design of it as does not hold the computer on when it is elevated by the legs in the back. I don't think the small tabs they supplied would really hold the computer if it was bumped. I do like it and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Runyon

customer_reviews.title: HAVIT Spend Good Time Making an Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: This blew me away. The product, the packaging, everything. HAVIT really spent a good amount of time perfecting this product. It's extremely straightforward and easy to use since you just plug in the fan in to the laptop (with the provided cord) and use the circle switch to adjust the fan speed and to turn it on or off. Everything down to the cord was well thought out. HAVIT did a really good job on this product. I am really pleased and I look forward into buying more of their products!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I've been satisfied so far. I can't speak to longevity but in the days I've been using the cooling pad it's worked well for my purposes. The pad seems to be made well and it's seems sturdy. I was concerned about the feet, but they have exceeded my expectation. Not 5 star due to noise, but it's still quieter than my old cooling pad (it was over 5 years old and only had 2 fans, this has 5 and it is quieter). I like you can adjust the speed of the fans with the dial. Simple and easy to use and it does the job. No slipping of my laptop even without the holder flipped open.
customer_reviews.author: hstoner

customer_reviews.title: The best cooling pad for the $ & size
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooling pad for my 17" HP, the only thing that I don't like is it doesn't have a carrying bag to transport it when I travel with the laptop. It is very quiet at all speeds and keeps the computer cool, sometimes I use the fan to aid me in a hot room like a personal fan. One of the base pads kept falling off but I just need to glue it back with gorilla glue or rubber cement. Otherwise it is amazing & well built.
customer_reviews.author: LA Cast

customer_reviews.title: lasted for 4 months, protection plan useless
customer_reviews.text: the cooling fan worked great but lasted a mere 4 months. at that point, the fan started making a loud and terrible noise and stopped working. since i had purchased the protection plan i attempted to file a claim, and was informed that my 'problem' was not covered. huh? i would pursue this further but i don't want to subject myself to further blood-pressure-raising frustration. plus my time is worth more than the $30 spent; i think that is how these protection plans are designed; they are purposely made to be difficult to actually obtain reimbursement or replacement, thereby wearing down the consumer. lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: cloudydaze

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this cooling pad. If you have it set up on a desk, you'll likely experience no problems at all. It is powerful, and keeps my lap from getting super hot as my laptop's internal fans aren't the greatest. The only downside is that the fans sometimes get off kilter or something and make an annoying noise. It usually goes away w/ some tapping of the cooling pad and doesn't last forever so I don't regret buying it, especially bc its so affordable.
customer_reviews.author: KCypher

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop fan I've had
customer_reviews.text: My laptop was overheating and thermal throttling my graphics card, making it impossible to play the games I wanted to. I saw this recommended on a forum to help keep the comp cool enough to avoid the thermal throttle (under 90 celsius). This fan did the trick. Keeps the laptop cool enough. Monitoring the temps before and after the fan, it makes about a 15-20 degree celsius difference. That's pretty awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works for a bit then doesnt
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a low-quality product it works well for a month but then the fans eventually stop spinning, the only thing that lasts long is the LED lights inside the product probably because they cant turn on fully off of the USB, speaking of the USB the passthrough port doesn't provide enough power to pass anything through. if you try to plug in a phone it won't charge even with the fans on minimum power. Overall get a different fan that is less extravagant for working features.
customer_reviews.author: Shazam

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Gaming Laptops
customer_reviews.text: My gaming laptop was starting to overheat with COD. I was having to lower setting on the graphics cards to stop the screen from distorting. I purchased the 5 fan cooling pad and was in business. I maxed everything out and overclocked the laptop and have had zero issues with overheating and screen discoloration. If your laptop gets hot, use this item. The knobs on the left let you control the fan speeds. Even on high setting, I don't think it is loud.
customer_reviews.author: Marc B.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I give it a 3 star because honestly.. My 17inch laptop is not running any cooler as other reviews state theirs do.. 89-91c before.. 97c max with on full blast. My next route is redoing the thermal paste on this laptop.. For reference this is my laptop: Lenovo y920 17ikb I7 7820hk 3.6-4.1ghz 4x8gb 2666mhz corsair ddr4 2x512gb pcie3x4 m.2 ssd 1x1tb evo 860 ssd Gtx 1070 full not max q Oh well least maybe I can play in bed without my jewels melting.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Laptop Nice and Cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically because gaming on my laptop seemed to make it too hot and I was worried it would damage itself. Did some research to figure out if these fans actually helped but couldn't get a definite answer. Gave it a shot anyways, and it's been working perfectly for over a year! Temps stay in a comfortable range when on, and it's not noisy at all. The extra USB slot on the fan doesn't seem to have enough power to use for charging a phone or something similar so plan to lose a USB on your laptop when in use, but that's only a small gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: My work computer runs for several hours a day so I wanted a good fan that would keep up and keep it cool. So far things have been working out well! At first I was wary when I plugged it in and found the fans to blow lightly even at the high setting. But I’ve been using this fan for 2 months now and haven’t once had an issue or felt the laptop heat up. I love that it’s light weight and that it’s power source is the computer, so I don’t have to worry about finding an outlet or batteries. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Koicat

customer_reviews.title: Pad is making a loud grinding noise
customer_reviews.text: I mostly would say that this is the perfect cooling pad for a gaming laptop. I have had this for little over 1 year and it is now making the most awful grinding noise. I have researched online and found that apparently the bearings go out. I don't know who to go to at Havit to find out what the problem is. Therefore I would say if, not to expect this product to last long, be ready to replace
customer_reviews.author: GENA R.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a good price. Fits my 17" laptop perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it for one day now...but it seems to work perfectly and as advertised. My only question is with the "Note" paragraph in the "Guide for Connecting Computer". It says "provided a piece of hidden non-slip pad for putting them in the groove of the cooling pad to prevent your laptop from slipping off." So is that piece of white foam that was in the box what your are referencing? And what groove of the cooling pad are you talking about where you put them into?
customer_reviews.author: George B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I thought it might be a little too big, but it fits perfectly. The five fans help since all the heat is at the back of the laptop. MacBooks seem to get so hot they almost burn your hand, and this really helps. Great product! And don't worry about whether you're getting the 'red' or the 'blue' version - you really don't see the light. And yes, you can just hear the fan, but barely.
customer_reviews.author: Piers A. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: good cooler
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few of these and this one works great under my MSI 15 inch gaming laptop. It keeps it cool. The fan is super quiet. Don't even notice it's on. The air doesn't blow up in your face like some do. It is well built and sturdy, yet light. Remember to vacuum it every few months if the dust builds up. That happens to all of them. And vacuum the bottom vents on your laptop too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lenovo gaming laptop, and no matter what I try, it overheats if I am in a graphics intensive game. I have one fan that can be attached, it works well, but if I can't have it on the bed with me, it must be attached on a hard surface. This cooling pad is a fantastic solution. I can have my laptop in bed with me, or on the armrest of the couch without worrying that it will overheat. The colour is fun and it doesn't drain the power faster than the plug can charge it (my other fan did). I recommend this for anyone with a gaming laptop and the red colour is a fun addition.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl H

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work... some of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, when I can actually get the unit to power on, it DOES seem to lower the temperature of the laptop. However, as time wears on, I have to flip the switch on-and-off several times in order for the power to come on. I like the height it gives, and the angle is pretty natural as well. The lighting color even matches my laptop backlight. The fact that its less than reliable is a drag, though. I have tried it on different USB ports with the same results. I like the idea, but I'll probably end up getting a different brand eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Surprising little details
customer_reviews.text: I have a very large old 17” laptop that often overheats. This cooler is the perfect size. I’m very surprised at how quiet it is. The base hooks up via usb to your laptop. There is a second USB port on the base to make up for taking the one on your laptop. There are little feet to raise the back of the device which can be helpful as the laptop is raised by about two inches.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Best used for stationary desk or table
customer_reviews.text: My fault for not realizing the upright option is limited to maybe an inch to inch and and half. I prefer other pads with arms where the pag and laptop can sit much more upright. Plus I put my laptop in my lap so the two stand pegs dog into my legs for this model. The USB ports are not snugly staying in place so if you move slightly you hear the disconnect and reconnection (a lot). Meh it’s ok for prob best for those who plan to sit at a desk or table
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay, fans are a bit weaker than expected.
customer_reviews.text: For having so may great reviews, I expected this thing to move air like a champ, and alas, it just moves are like a kinda. Feels really cheaply made, but that's no big deal. Long story short, it will cool my laptop down AFTER a good gaming session, but is to weak to move enough air to keep my tagets in the yellow during gaming. I rate C+ for gaming, B for general use.
customer_reviews.author: Stonebrew

customer_reviews.title: I do really love the pop up lip in the front of it
customer_reviews.text: so far I am going to give this a 5 star ( have only had this for month and a half) it is not loud at all even fully turned up. I have only had a need to use 1 USB port for the power between it and my PC. I do really love the pop up lip in the front of it. It helps to keep my new laptop in place with out fear that when I tilt my portable PC stand that my computer may shift and fall. I would buy this again and do recommend it for larger style laptops (mine is a 17").
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: Quiet. But came broken.
customer_reviews.text: I didnt want to leave only 2 stars because it works for what I need it to do. Just annoyed that out of the box the bottom left fan does not spin. I think there may be a loose connection because it works intermittently but you have to squeeze or shake it to work. Honestly I don't even need the fan as my laptop doesnt have vents or even gets hot there. Like I said, I'm just annoyed that I paid over 20 for it and it doesnt fully work. Other than that issue, it works great. Very quiet, and it keeps my laptop cool while playing games.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: So good we bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little system which is both as effective as it is aesthetically pleasing. The red light provides a gaming ambiance while the fans adequately cool your lap top or gaming device; we also use one for our Xbox One. Yep, we were so impressed by this that we bought a second one to keep our Xbox from overheating. This is a great value, and since buying them we’ve had no issues (over 6 months for one, and a year for the first we bought).
customer_reviews.author: Napoleon0469

customer_reviews.title: A+ well packaged, great looks, good CFM air flow. Keeps laptop cool. Worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it short. OVERALL A+. WORTH THE PURCHASE. Fantastic Item packaging. Great looks. Nothing over the top. Nice red LED that changes brightness/dim via the fan speed switch. Higher speed, brighter fans. Has 2 USB 2.0 ports, comes with 1 cable for laptop to cooler connection. Extra port allows mouse, or keyboard, etc plug in. The CFM this flows won't levitate your laptop from power, but is definitely good enough for a few C drop In temperature. Really nice for longer sessions. But will help no matter how long you use it for. Absolutely worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: I have an Asus with a bizarre vent system (it vents right at the hinge of the lid?) so I was struggling to find a way to cool my laptop appropriately for games. I don't do anything super graphics intensive, just Sims 4 and the like, but it made my computer run super hot. This cooler does a great job of helping my computer stay cool. It runs so quietly I can barely hear it, and the lights aren't super bright/annoying. I had no problems getting it going and it has really made a difference for my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Green

customer_reviews.title: Cure while gaming
customer_reviews.text: Although I have a gaming laptop it gets quite hot during gaming. I had a dual-fan cooling pad earlier that didn't do much at all max 3-4 degrees but this one really does the job. I get a minimum of -10 degrees while gaming. What's more the pad design is good and isn't too noisy. The only downside is that it vibrates a little bit on max fan speed. Overall good cooling pad for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Levan Goderdzishvili

customer_reviews.title: easy to use on lap
customer_reviews.text: Have bought 4 of these despite fact that cable connecting fan to laptop tends to stop working quickly. But love fan so much kept investing in new ones. Finally occurred to me to contact Havit directly and they have supplied me with new cables for free and now I can use all fans again. Hopefully they will find a way to improve the cable, but as long as you can get a cable replacement, I haven't found a better cooling fan (I've tried many)
customer_reviews.author: In My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I want to be clear that after contacting Havit, they sent me a new unit with no hassle, however, there is an inherent design flaw in the design of the unit (the replacement has now lasted 2 years but has the same issue with the short in the on/off switch) for anyone who uses a laptop IN THEIR LAP, the on/off switch will rub against the chair arm and eventually short out. A few months ago my cooler developed a short in the speed control knob. It also makes a horrid loud sound intermittently. If you don't mind replacing your cooler on an almost yearly basis, this unit is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Work As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product claims to fit 17” laptops, it doesn’t. The fans don’t help cool at all when under load, partly because the fans barely provide any airflow. You’re better off putting your laptop on a tray or something and saving your money. I will say it looked pretty good and the usb pass through is nice.
customer_reviews.author: piper diehl

customer_reviews.title: and the fan end up taking off like a plane at low settings
customer_reviews.text: A normal cooling pad, I use an Asus FX503 not a top grade gaming laptop but does what it needs, I usually play Far Cry 4 And Dying Light, and the fan end up taking off like a plane at low settings . So far instead of taking off within seconds of gaming it takes off only when I run the games on moderate settings after about 15-30 minutes. Before: Using The Laptop Cooler: Temp Idle: 35-44 C 33-37 C Temp Playing Skyrim: 75-80 C 45-67 C Far Cry 4 : 60-78+C 56-64 C
customer_reviews.author: Eric T.

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap and underpowered
customer_reviews.text: All 5 fans work like they should, but very underpowered and made very little difference in CPU temp (5° Celsius or less), and computer even got hotter than it ever has while gaming, even with it on. Would recommend if you have a cheap laptop with little storage where you can actually store anything that requires extra power that would make your computer work harder where it would need a secondary cooldown source like this. Would not recommend if you do anything other than browse the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for it's price. Lasted 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this is discontinued, but figured I'd leave a review for mine after one fan finally went out. Overall pretty solid for a cooling pad. Quiet and kept my Omen 15 relatively cool, even since I got it. Which is impressive, considering the thing wants to set itself on fire if let on its own. Gonna try a different style of cooling pad to see how it goes. I would like to get the temperature even lower. But, I'll probably come back to Havit down the road if the new fan isn't worth the price. Overall not going to make your laptop ice cold, but will keep it from catching fire! XD
customer_reviews.author: Bishie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic fan for laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one for another laptop. These cooler pads by this company are high-rated and deserve that. You can feel the air move, but hear no noise. Never a problem, the first one I've had for years and it still works great. I bought the first one when that laptop started getting a burn smell. Awful. The fans took care of it.
customer_reviews.author: netmouse

customer_reviews.title: Great cooling pad, questionable USB connector
customer_reviews.text: The size is great, and fan placement works for both my personal and work laptops (15" & 17"). I like the flap that keeps your laptop from sliding off, and the ability to tilt the cooling pad up is terrific. No issue with the power switch wheel for adjusting fans and turning the pad on/ off. However, with almost daily use since my purchase, the covering of the USB connector is already fraying! That's the only negative to an otherwise great product. Unclear how long it will last :(
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: SUPER Quiet but it's more design OVER Functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Here's the deal - THIS IS NOT A BAD REVIEW, but a real world review. The design around the corners is so gamey/techie that the fans are more centralized. This detracts from the fans' effectiveness in blowing air directly to my SSD and hot section of my Hp Pavilion - thus I normally shift my laptop about 1-2" to the left, so it sits dirrectly overlop the upper left fan.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. SCOTT

customer_reviews.title: I like that this pad lays flat and has the tab ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that this pad lays flat and has the tab to keep my laptop stable if I do choose to slant it. I once owned a cooling pad that was built on a slant and had no tabs to hold it in place. My laptop slid off several times because of it. This pad moves a decent amount of air and keeps my laptop about 10 to 20 degrees cooler when on maxium setting. The only con I can think of at the moment is that I wish there was an option to turn off the red led lights when the cooling pad is in use. The lights are unnecessary and can be annoying, especially at night.
customer_reviews.author: Amarande

customer_reviews.title: Great bulid quality, a little bulkier than I'd like.
customer_reviews.text: Product works great at providing airflow under your laptop, the fans aren't too fast where it forces air into the laptop, but are just fast enough to circulate air and keep the laptop keyboard surface cool. I remember my laptop being to hot to touch sometimes when playing big games but now it's comfortable. Have not noticed any improvement in PC performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Works for ASUS, HP Laptops x 3
customer_reviews.text: Has purchased 4 of these HAVIT 5 Fans Laptop Cooling Pad for 14-17 Inch Laptop Coolers, 2 for me, 2 for friends. Have a year's use on 2 Havits without complaint. Both ASUS & HP laptops are well within temperature specs. Systems up 24/7/365. ASUS 2.4ghz quad processors clock in @ 3.3ghz w/ Samsung SSD 860 Pro. The extra USB port comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: M Belanger

customer_reviews.title: It was great at first ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in April of 2019, fast-forward to January 2020 and it’s so noisy I can’t sleep unless I turn it off completely which is not good because I keep my laptop running all night... it literally sounds like a lawn mower! And I haven’t dropped it or anything — I also regularly dust it daily. Overall, I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Great works on Alienware 17 R4
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!! Using it on my Alienware 17R4 and it fits perfectly. Seriously all others on Amazon will be too small or blocking the fans. Not this one!!! Also build quality is top notch! Love that the port and slider are on the left of the laptop. Much more convenient then the back! Must buy!!
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job in exchange for bulkiness and noisiness.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my laptop which is prone to overheating cool. Occasional horrendous noises. Garbage disposal level noises. Feels a bit bulky. A must for my particular laptop but I'm sure other coolers might do a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T Foose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: 1. You can really feel the air coming out and the top mesh becomes cold like car windows in a cold spring night. Place a tissue paper on top and see it glide like Aladdin's carpet. Of-course it can't be used as a personal fan. 2. It didn't help a lot for my HP Envy, however I adjusted my laptop to a convenient position so one of the fans was DIRECTLY below the heating area and it did produce good results then. 3. Not too loud. 4. The height adjustment angle isn't ideal. Identify your laptop heating areas first and then order cooling pads. This one is really good as it has multiple fans covering almost the entire base.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Is just "Ok". Fans very slow, 1 fan died after 2 months. May work if you only need minimal cooling.
customer_reviews.text: I may have had too high of expectations, but it was only able to keep my laptop ~1-3 degrees cooler than not using it. The fans just don't spin fast enough to move enough heat (albeit, my laptop does put off a lot of heat with a GTX1060 inside). Expectations aside, I could have given it 4 stars if one of the fans didn't die after <2 months of use making the ~1-3 degrees go out the window because it was the fan directly under the GPU which is producing most of the heat. Don't expect massive cooling, but if you just need to keep your laptop a little cooler you may have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Bain

customer_reviews.title: Works great, can be noisy but not annoying
customer_reviews.text: It can be a bit loud but it's fine when gaming. I just wouldn't use it in a quiet room with others, unless you don't care about the sound. It keeps my gaming laptop cool. The usb cord is giving me trouble now. It's been bent and if it moves a bit it stops the fan from working, so I may just use another one. Not an issue with the fan, just the usb cord.
customer_reviews.author: Hala

customer_reviews.title: Didn't do much and noisy
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the other reviews here, I bought this thinking it would be able to cool my MSI GL73 laptop a little bit. Either those reviews are fake or paid for or maybe this works for some laptops but not others like mine. I see no difference in CPU temperature at load (which for this laptop runs in the 80-90 C range). Also, the fans make a faint whine which gets annoying after awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Amarillo by morning

customer_reviews.title: Not a very solid build, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: Not a marvel in electronic engineering but it works and it does what it is supposed to do. After a few months, the fan speed control wheel broke. It was already in the run position so I just have to unplug it. I use it for gaming, and it does fine. It is fairly quiet and very lightweight. It's worth the $25.00.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H

customer_reviews.title: Pairing it with my Acer Nitro 5. Works well
customer_reviews.text: Less noise on max speed than the laptops fans, moves a solid amount of air and seems decently built. small amount of plastic bend, but only if you get both hands on it and go looking for the flex. If I ever get time to do a temp test on this setup I will update my review, but so far I've been able to grind intense games and be able to pick up the laptop and go without much heat on the chassis.
customer_reviews.author: Young R.

customer_reviews.title: So quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I love my computer, but it was literally burning my thighs. This platform is nearly silent and saves both my thighs and my computer from undue wear and tear. Also, has a usb port to make up for the one it uses, so you don't have to go without another peripheral.
customer_reviews.author: Grim

customer_reviews.title: Loud-ish fan bearings, but functions as advertised. Wear headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this instead of other, more highly rated cooling pads because it matches my Omen's color scheme, but the fans are a lot louder than I expected. I'm talking about bearing noise, not wind noise. Though, you can only hear the bearings when above half speed. Can't hear them over the jet turbine that is my laptop's internal fan though, and even less so when you have a headset/headphones on. It keeps the laptop 10-15c cooler than before, though, so I'm forgiving the fan noise.
customer_reviews.author: ChickenDinner

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a chipped off piece of plastic. So to start the product I got is damaged and defective. The USB sockets are loose, everything wiggles around easily and feels like it's going to fall out. The fans are typically super quiet but sometimes become off balance and start making noise like they are loose and wobbling around in there. The fans also aren't very strong, it creates a very weak breeze when at max. That being said, it does keep my gaming laptop slightly cooler, about 5-10 degrees Celsius and keeps my laptop fans from maxing out all the time. I suppose a well made version of this product would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, lightweight, and excellent customer support!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cooling fan for four and a half months. It has worked as expected. It's nice and quiet as it runs most of the day to help cool my 15" Macbook. I like that it is lightweight and fits into my laptop bag when I'm away from home. It recently started running intermittently, and I suspected it was that the USB cord was going bad. I contacted HAVIT Customer Support on Monday at noon and had a new power cord by Wednesday. Now it's running perfectly again. That's great customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Really good cooling device for a gaming laptop.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device to keep your laptop cool. I got it for my Omen laptop and it keeps the heat down almost completely! I played for 6 hours on my day off and the heat never increased to a bad level. This really works! I will say that I start it as soon as I turn on my laptop for gaming and never turn it off but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: This thing is cool.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. works well, keeps my laptop about 5-10 degrees cooler under load on average. I wish the fans would spin faster but its basically silent and i havent had any issues with my older gaming laptop overheating since my previous garbage laptop cooler died and ive started using this one. you dont see the red, but it is cool because red is cool which makes the air cooler and thats the entire point. I will not apologize for the dadjoke in the title.
customer_reviews.author: Jermo47

customer_reviews.title: Good cooling option for the money
customer_reviews.text: I use this product at all times while the laptop is running. I use it to play games, stream, and do some work with iso's/7zip, etc. Before I purchased this product the laptop ran about 40-43 degrees Celsius at idle on all 4 cores, now, it runs 32-37 depending on room temperature. While playing AAA titles, or throttling the CPU in 7zip it usually runs 53-58C, whereas it was hitting as high as 70C before. For the money, its a solid option for cooling the laptop. Fairly quiet. Could provide more airflow in my opinion, but, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brown

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the laptop cool; quiet and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to cool an old Lenovo T410s laptop. The laptop used to shutdown caused by overheating, but since i started using this cooling pad, the overheating stopped. You can hear the fan, but it doesn't bother me and is quiet enough for me. It is very sturdy, i can use it on a table and on my lap. I'll buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be weary of the fans
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, 3 out of 5 fans worked, later got a forth to work, has a solid lightweight design, wished it had better fans though, will still work on fan 5 (lower right hand), but in the long run my laptop gets hot on the left side and it cools decently
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased!
customer_reviews.text: It's doing the job it was designed to do, I use my laptop like a desktop most of the time, so it runs constantly. The fan in on a shelf above the monitor with the laptop on top of it. I hardly know it's there. I have it set to run at the highest speed (the room is warm) and it's almost silent. And I like that I can adjust the height of the back so that when I use the laptop as a laptop (when I travel) it gives the keyboard a better angle.
customer_reviews.author: Janet G. Rivenbark

customer_reviews.title: Did not notice 1 degree difference of cooling on laptop
customer_reviews.text: Own a MSI GSX673VR when running FPS games i am pegging around 90C degrees - was looking for something to try to cool it down abit Bought this - fits perfectly under the laptop , however even with all its fans - did not notice much difference in temps so - for me - this was not a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Nutshell

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: I have had this cooler almost 2 years. My laptop is ALWAYS on, 24/7. Since I put a faster processor in, my acer would overheat when watching movies. This cooling pad has stopped the heat problem. It is getting a little noisy now, so I will be buying another one soon. For the price it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great value - ignore the whiners!
customer_reviews.text: For $30, this is a great fan array that will keep a high performance laptop out of overheating danger. Ignore the reviewers complaining about the slide-switch breaking. If one is buying this fan array because one wants top cooling performance, then one will not have any need to constantly play with the slide-switch because one will simply leave it at the highest setting and enjoy better laptop performance.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these fans because I am a little rough on them. Still using the first one after a year, good tough durable product. If you have a fan broke in your computer as I do, this was a great alternative to paying a computer repair place big bucks to fix it. My computer never overheats now with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended for HP G71
customer_reviews.text: Based on reviews here and on YouTube, I tested out this cooling pad for my laptop. It didn't keep my computer cool at all. While it has 5 fans, the blades are small and it really doesn't pick up enough airflow and distribute it as needed. I went back to a Tree New Bee Cooling Pad for a 17" laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kline

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but...
customer_reviews.text: This worked great at first. The fan was purchased six months ago, and is now losing juice. I’ve tried different power sources of varying power output. My HP gaming laptop (the brand is significantly lower quality in recent years) sounds like a NASA Rocket Shuttle taking off; after three years. I purchased the fan because it was a perfect average between review value and price. But in hindsight, I wish I would have invested a bit more money for something that would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what needed to keep computer from shutting down
customer_reviews.text: I have a refurbished HP 20XX and the fan is starting to quit. So much so that my computer warns me it can't work anymore because the conditions are too hot. I looked into buying a new fan but tried this instead. The cooling pad is doing the trick. Even if the computer gets warm, it's not shutting down anymore. I will still be moving everything over to an external hard drive...just in case. But for now, game unpaused.
customer_reviews.author: NEO_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should do
customer_reviews.text: My gaming ASUS ROG laptop used to heat up to 80 degrees C while gaming, now it barely gets over 50 degrees with this cooling pad. It's nice and convenient to use on a desk and I can plug in my mouse to the cooling pad, and plug the pad into my laptop so I save USB space for other devices. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this not too long ago and unfortunately on the fans stopped working pretty quickly after that. It isn't a bad cooling pad when it works, but unfortunately it has its issues. I doubt I'll be buying another from this brand after returning the one that broke on me.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Quiet with adjustable speed fans great for coolong laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I purchased. The first was for my company laptop which feels hot after several hours. The unit keeps my work laptop cool. My personal laptop is a an older Sony Vaio, that also heat up with usage. I like that you can adjust the speed of the fans as well as you can adjust the unit to tilt at the back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Clemens
